paragraphs.content: Chapter 18
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 18

paragraphs.content: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

paragraphs.content: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?

paragraphs.content: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?
paragraphs.contentHtml: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?

paragraphs.content: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

paragraphs.content: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.

paragraphs.content: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.

paragraphs.content: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.

paragraphs.content: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.

paragraphs.content: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.

paragraphs.content: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.

paragraphs.content: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.

paragraphs.content: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.

paragraphs.content: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.

paragraphs.content: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

paragraphs.content: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.

paragraphs.content: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.

paragraphs.content: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.

paragraphs.content: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

paragraphs.content: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.

paragraphs.content: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
